title: Soraka
body: It is interesting to notice, that her lore wasn't reworked. Actually its very outdated. The story wasn't reworked at the Warwick rework, nor at the vastayas(she could be one) and she wasn't reworked with this irelia update too... My question is, why?

replies.body: Thanks guys, i am waiting for an official Riot response if possible.

Thank you for reaching out!

We've said a few times recently, we are working to update Soraka's bio to fit into the more current lore. We're just looking for the best time to release pieces of content like that, which don't fit into the overall plan/strategy for story stuffs.
Dude...know when I say this it's because I care. But don't wait until it's too late and no one cares anymore.

"Wait" would imply that I have the deciding vote on such things...

If it was up to me, it'd be today :-P
I don't mean you in general though. Understandable, but you have to understand where I'm coming from.
agreed.

im running out of snacks while i wait! please do something!

also...what about Sona?

when you do manage to update her lore, may I at suggest that at the very least, she's got some sort of connection to Karthus? I find it interesting how for this long they've been considered rivals, but technically they've never even met each other afaik. You don't often see someone from the Shadow Isles have some sort of main connection to other champs in the world (except Lucian/Thresh), so I think it'd be interesting to see what Karthus and Raka think of each other.

I don't think that in order for 2 champions to be rivals that they need to have met eachother.

For example Illaoi hates everyone (other than Maokai and Elise) in the shadow isles (also the "good" one Yorick) because those guys go strictly against everything she believes in.

Maybe if Illaoi and Yorick met then she would realize that they share a common goal.

Karthus wants to "kill" everyone and put them in a situation where they are in between life and death (where Karthus is right now), Soraka on the other hand wants to do the exact opposite.

I think that is enough to say that IF they ever meet eachother then they would be rivals.

So can we take that to mean that the previous lore updates have all been about interrelated champions, and Soraka just wasn't one of them?  As in, Yasuo may not be directly related to Irelia (... don't quote me on that, haven't read it yet), but both of them play into the bigger picture of what Ionia is like; and while Ahri may not be specifically related to Xayah/Rakan (this one I am pretty sure of, haha), but all three of them paint of picture of what the Vastaya are all about.  I was half-expecting Soraka to be in with a Targon update, but I'm more interested if she doesn't quite "fit in" like that, actually.

She needs to move to targon asap. No offense, I like the old lore but I think she doesn't belong to ionia anymore and she fits way more in the targon category now.
Why?
Because space empire. Soraka i suppose can fit in that group.
"Twinkle twinkle Little star, do you wonder what you are?"  - Aurelion {{champion:136}}
Well we all do

When {{champion:19}} was reworked Riot had to choose between his relations with {{champion:27}} and {{champion:16}}. They wanted to aligned his as a Zaun champion, so they went with Singed can made his transformation purely chemtech related opposed to the magical potion used in his old lore.

In {{champion:39}}'s old lore she was saved by Soraka, however (**imo**), that took away from her lore. Now her new lore is focused around her struggle as someone brought up in a war torn Ionia, and leader of a resistance. Soraka doesn't fit into that story in anyway but to oppose it, not saying that Soraka and Irelia won't work well together. I'd actually bet, they'd still meet in a future story however, that would not have worked for her origin story.

>A wanderer from the celestial dimensions beyond Mount Targon, Soraka gave up her immortality to protect the mortal races from their own more violent instincts. She endeavors to spread the virtues of compassion and mercy to everyone she meets—even healing those who would wish harm upon her. And, for all Soraka has seen of this world's struggles, she still believes the people of Runeterra have yet to reach their full potential.

Soraka's new lore, she is related Targon and kept her origin as a celestial banished from the 'heavens', and based on {{champion:267}}'s lore, {{champion:131}}  is headed to Ionia, more than likely (**my theory**) to meet Soraka.

At least Soraka had connections to other champions before, and has plenty of possible places in the new lore.

The two champions in the worst state lore-wise right now are probably Nidalee and Sona, who unlike Fiddle/Nocturne don't have the excuse of being nightmarish demons. Sona arguably has it worse because she got outright ignored in the Demacia updates aside from her adoptive family being mentioned once in Quinn's story, and her very minimalistic lore hasn't been updated at all since her release.

Hell, Pentakill Sona, a non-canon skin, has more lore and character than canon Sona does.
It's a real shame, because it's not even like they have nothing they could possibly do with her either. Some neat character interactions with Lux are totally possible with how Demacia is.

Can't wait to have some love given to my main.. it's been a while. 

{{sticker:sg-soraka}}
They don't even know whether she is blue or purple, so maybe they just don't know what to do with her for now.

She actually did get a small lore update on the front of her universe page:

_"A wanderer from the celestial dimensions beyond Mount Targon, Soraka gave up her immortality to protect the mortal races from their own more violent instincts. She endeavors to spread the virtues of compassion and mercy to everyone she meets—even healing those who would wish harm upon her. And, for all Soraka has seen of this world's struggles, she still believes the people of Runeterra have yet to reach their full potential."_

...But that's it.

Personally, I don't like it all that much and wish she could have remained Ionian, and I'm also a little miffed that she didn't get a larger-scale update when Targon got its update, so she's in a state of limbo right now, I guess. That small little blurb conflicts with her biography on the Universe page, and it would have been nice to get an update on her considering she was just written out of Warwick and now Irelia's lore. 

_"As her life ebbed, Soraka, the Starchild, made a final attempt to anchor her fading soul. Unwilling to relinquish her home, Irelia rose at the brink of death, and her father's weapon lifted into the air alongside her. Irelia rushed back to the fore, unfazed by the blade's sudden animation. "_

So where does she belong, Riot? As someone who has loved Soraka for plenty of seasons now, what are you going to do with her? Her connections with other champions made her incredibly interesting, and it's sad to see her fade out of existence. She doesn't even have that many interactions with champions in-game anymore. Is there any hope for more Soraka involvement in champion updates/lore updates?
